main event: A civilian reported sighting a very bright silvery bluish round object near a ship in Kisalon, Mindanao, Philippines on 17 May 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as more brilliant than Venus., It covered a 50-degree arc in less than 1 minute., The object appeared to exhibit guided movement., Father Riesner, a Jesuit, was the main observer of the sighting., Various possibilities were noted for the object including balloon, aircraft, meteor, or other unidentified phenomena.
sighted object: a very bright silvery bluish round object
witness description: Father Riesner, a society of Jesuits
